triples.name: TOPSIS
triples.relevance: TOPSIS is the core ranking method used to rank promotional products based on their similarity to an ideal solution.

triples.name: Multiple-criteria decision analysis
triples.relevance: The paper applies MCDM principles through SWARA and TOPSIS to structure the product selection problem involving multiple evaluation criteria.

triples.name: E-commerce
triples.relevance: E-commerce is the application domain in which the paper conducts its product selection research for promotional purposes.

triples.name: Decision analysis
triples.relevance: Decision analysis provides the theoretical framework for structuring and solving the promotional product selection problem.

triples.name: Decision matrix
triples.relevance: The decision matrix method is the underlying approach used to evaluate and compare multiple product alternatives against weighted criteria.

triples.name: Product selection
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel automated framework for promotional product selection in e-commerce using SWARA and TOPSIS methods.
